Description of incident: More than 900 current and former            COTA employees recently learned their Social Security numbers had been            sent to dozens of health-insurance companies. Central Ohio Transit Authority            officials notified administrative employees who have or had worked for            COTA since 2004 that personnel workers gave 51 companies their names            and identification numbers. The information went to companies proposing            to bid on providing long-term disability insurance to COTA. In 2006,            COTA also sent information on union employees to 39 potential insurance            providers.
